participant_abstract.sent: The two designers and the marketing manager presented their resarch competently and clearly.
My marketing presentation brought information to the project about what people use and what people find annoying about a remote control which had an influence over the final design.
The industrial designer presented the workings of a remote control, and the user interface designer presented information on what makes remote controls user-friendly.

The project manager reminded us of some information that had been passed to him by the management - that the time to market must be small, and that the design should incorportate the company logo and colour.

participant_actions.sent: The design team will investigate the configuration of buttons on the rear panel, and present reccommendations.
The design team will come up with a specific design based on the decisions made about the functions we want on the remote.
The project manager will summarise the last meeting and devise an agenda for the next meeting.
The project manager will keep us informed of any decisions from the management.
The marketing manager will investigate whether people like the design of the remote we have decided on.

participant_decisions.sent: The project manager promised to communicate company directives to the workers when he received them, rather than at meetings, so we could plan effectively.
We decided that as losing the remote is a major annoyance, we would put a hand-clap recognition function into it.
There will be no teletext function as this is not used much now because of the internet.
Because some buttons are used more often than others, there will be the important buttons on the front and less-often-used buttons on the back, under a panel.

The front panel buttons are 16 in number - numbers 0-9, volume +/-, mute, power, channel +/- We decided on a few buttons for the rear panel - brightness and contrast, tuning +/- and 'confirm' - and decided to do more resarch on audio and picture adjustment buttons.

participant_problems.sent: The project manager told us a couple of pieces of information that he maybe should have told us before the meeting - this is more important for the design team than me.
I should have taken time to email those design-specific aspects of the market resarch to the design team, so they could maybe adjust their presentations to take account of them.
Perhaps I should have done my presentation first, as it's important to show what the customer wants before designing.
